title: Steve Earle And The Supersuckers EP (1997)
description:
Steve Earle And The Supersuckers EP - 1997                       

The Supersuckers decided to up the country ante during  
the recording of their fourth album, Must&#039;ve Been High, 
turning themselves into some kind of genuine cow-punks  
(the group was always punkier and rowdier than any &#039;80s 
cowpunk outfit). 

So, it was only fitting that the band followed the album 
with a split-single with the punkiest country singer of 
the &#039;80s, Steve Earle. 

In classic Sub Pop tradition - think the classic 
Mudhoney/Jimmie Dale Gilmore split single, in particular, 
but there&#039;s loads others - the Suckers tackle an Earle 
song ("Angel is the Devil") and Earle covers one of their 
tunes ("Creepy Jackalope Eye"), then after a joint cover 
(the Rolling Stones&#039; "Before They Make Me Run," the 
definitive Keith anthem), the originals are offered up. 

Earle does better with "Creepy Jackalope Eye" than the 
Suckers do with Angel is the Devil," though it could be 
argued from the originals that he had more to work with 
than the band.

Unfortunately, they manage to tame "Before They Make Me 
Run," taking it slower than it needs to be and truncating 
the original riff. Which leaves the single as a mixed bag 
- a good cover and original from Earle, a good original 
from the Supersuckers, and a pair of so-so covers. 

Not a terrible average, but not a great one, either.


Artist  : Steve Earle                          
Album   : Steve Earle and The Supersuckers     
Tracks  : 5                                    
Time    : 0:13 hours
Bitrate : 192kbps
Size    : 18MB                                 
Label   : Sub Pop Records                       
Released: 06/10/1997  


TRACK INFORMATION

02 Angel Is The Devil                             1:48
03 Before They Make Me Run                        3:50

This is currently out of print and is only available second hand. The record company has forced my hand to upload this for Earle&#039;s Fans.
